sn2.6:1.2: Standing to one side, the god Kāmada said to the Buddha,
sn2.6:1.3: “It’s too hard, Blessed One! It’s just too hard!”
sn2.6:2.1: “They do it even though it’s hard,”
sn2.6:2.3: “the stable trainees with ethics, and immersion.
sn2.6:2.4: For one who has entered the homeless life,
sn2.6:3.1: “Such contentment, Blessed One, is hard to find.”
sn2.6:4.1: “They find it even though it’s hard,”
sn2.6:5.1: “But it’s hard, Blessed One, to immerse this mind in samādhi.”
sn2.6:6.1: “They become immersed in samādhi <j>even though it’s hard,”
sn2.6:6.4: Having cut through the net of Death,
sn2.6:6.5: the noble ones, Kāmada, go on their way.”
sn2.6:7.1: “But this path, Blessed One, is rough and hard to travel.”
sn2.6:8.2: the noble ones, Kāmada, go on their way.
sn2.6:8.5: But the path of the noble ones is smooth,
sn2.6:8.6: for the noble ones are smooth amid the rough.”
